page.title: 03Ardross - main settlement
page.content: Ardross has one church: the village is small and set back from the main road. There are four sets of semi-detached council houses, one bungalow and a telephone box. Four sets of cottages face the road: the rest of the village contains a further 7 houses whuch face onto farmland. Most of the surrounding land is cultivated. The people of the village are mostly elderly and retired: the rest are married with children. Apart from the 4 semi-detached houses owned by the council the rest (bar one) are owner occupied or tied. Only one is a 'holiday home'. The tied houses are occupied by the farm-workers. Most of the villagers have their own mode of transport due to the fact that there is no public transport. Most villagers grow their own vegetables complaining the shop is too expensive.
